t: Zephaniah 1
Day of Judgment on Judah
The*p word of the Lord*s which came to Zephaniah son of Cushi, son of Gedaliah, son of Amariah, son of Hezekiah, in the days of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah:
“I*pn will completely remove all things*i From*ln the face of the earth,” declares the Lord.*s

“I*ln will remove man and beast; I*ln will remove the birds of the sky And*ln the fish of the sea, And*ln the ruins along with the wicked; And*ln I will cut off man from the face of the earth,” declares the Lord.*s

“So*ln I will stretch out My hand against Judah And*ln against all the inhabitants of Jerusalem. And*ln I will cut off the remnant of Baal from this place, And*iln the names of the idolatrous priests along with the priests.
And*ln those who bow down on the housetops to the host of heaven, And*ln those who bow down and*i swear to the Lord*s and yet*i swear by Milcom,
And*ln those who have turned back from following the Lord,*s And*ln those who have not sought the Lord*s or inquired of Him.”
Be*ln silent before the Lord God!*s For*ln the day of the Lord*s is near, For*ln the Lord*s has prepared a sacrifice, He*ln has consecrated His guests.
“Then*ln it will come about on the day of the Lord’s*s sacrifice That*ln I will punish the princes, the king’s sons And*ln all who clothe themselves with foreign garments.
And*ln I will punish on that day all who leap on the temple*i threshold, Who*ln fill the house of their lord with violence and deceit.
On*ln that day,” declares the Lord,*s “There*ln will be the sound of a cry from the Fish Gate, A*ln wail from the Second Quarter, And*ln a loud crash from the hills.
Wail,*ln O inhabitants of the Mortar, For*ln all the people of Canaan will be silenced; All*ln who weigh out silver will be cut off.

It*ln will come about at that time That*ln I will search Jerusalem with lamps, And*ln I will punish the men Who*ln are stagnant in spirit, Who*ln say in their hearts, ‘The*ln Lord*s will not do good or evil!’
Moreover,*ln their wealth will become plunder And*ln their houses desolate; Yes,*ln they will build houses but not inhabit them,*i And*ln plant vineyards but not drink their wine.”
Near*ln is the great day of the Lord,*s Near*ln and coming very quickly; Listen,*ln the day of the Lord!*s In*ln it the warrior cries out bitterly.
A*ln day of wrath is that day, A*ln day of trouble and distress, A*ln day of destruction and desolation, A*ln day of darkness and gloom, A*ln day of clouds and thick darkness,
A*ln day of trumpet and battle cry Against*ln the fortified cities And*ln the high corner towers.
I*ln will bring distress on men So*ln that they will walk like the blind, Because*ln they have sinned against the Lord;*s And*ln their blood will be poured out like dust And*ln their flesh like dung.

Neither*ln their silver nor their gold Will*ln be able to deliver them On*ln the day of the Lord’s*s wrath; And*ln all the earth will be devoured In*ln the fire of His jealousy, For*ln He will make a complete end, Indeed*ln a terrifying one, Of*ln all the inhabitants of the earth.
Zephaniah 2
Judgments on Judah’s Enemies
Gather*pn yourselves together, yes, gather, O*ln nation without shame,
Before*ln the decree takes effect— The*ln day passes like the chaff— Before*ln the burning anger of the Lord*s comes upon you, Before*ln the day of the Lord’s*s anger comes upon you.
Seek*ln the Lord,*s All*ln you humble of the earth Who*ln have carried out His ordinances; Seek*ln righteousness, seek humility. Perhaps*ln you will be hidden In*ln the day of the Lord’s*s anger.
For*ln Gaza will be abandoned And*ln Ashkelon a desolation; Ashdod*ln will be driven out at noon And*ln Ekron will be uprooted.

Woe*ln to the inhabitants of the seacoast, The*ln nation of the Cherethites! The*ln word of the Lord*s is against you, O*ln Canaan, land of the Philistines; And*ln I will destroy you So*ln that there will be no inhabitant.
So*ln the seacoast will be pastures, With*iln caves for shepherds and folds for flocks.

And*ln the coast will be For*ln the remnant of the house of Judah, They*ln will pasture on it. In*ln the houses of Ashkelon they will lie down at evening; For*ln the Lord*s their God will care for them And*ln restore their fortune.
“I*ln have heard the taunting of Moab And*ln the revilings of the sons of Ammon, With*ln which they have taunted My people And*ln become arrogant against their territory.

Therefore,*ln as I live,” declares the Lord*s of hosts, The*ln God of Israel, “Surely*ln Moab will be like Sodom And*ln the sons of Ammon like Gomorrah— A*ln place possessed by nettles and salt pits, And*ln a perpetual desolation. The*ln remnant of My people will plunder them And*ln the remainder of My nation will inherit them.”
This*p they will have in return for their pride, because they have taunted and become arrogant against the people of the Lord*s of hosts.
The Lord*s will be terrifying to them, for He will starve all the gods of the earth; and all the coastlands of the nations will bow down to Him, everyone from his own*i place.
“You*pn also, O Ethiopians, will be slain by My sword.”
And*ln He will stretch out His hand against the north And*ln destroy Assyria, And*ln He will make Nineveh a desolation, Parched*ln like the wilderness.

Flocks*ln will lie down in her midst, All*ln beasts which range in herds; Both*ln the pelican and the hedgehog Will*ln lodge in the tops of her pillars; Birds*ln will sing in the window, Desolation*ln will*i be*i on the threshold; For*ln He has laid bare the cedar work.

This*ln is the exultant city Which*ln dwells securely, Who*ln says in her heart, “I*ln am, and there is no one besides me.” How*ln she has become a desolation, A*ln resting place for beasts! Everyone*ln who passes by her will hiss And*iln wave his hand in*i contempt.*i
Zephaniah 3
Woe to Jerusalem and the Nations
Woe*pn to her who is rebellious and defiled, The*ln tyrannical city!
She*ln heeded no voice, She*ln accepted no instruction. She*ln did not trust in the Lord,*s She*ln did not draw near to her God.
Her*ln princes within her are roaring lions, Her*ln judges are wolves at evening; They*ln leave nothing for the morning.
Her*ln prophets are reckless, treacherous men; Her*ln priests have profaned the sanctuary. They*ln have done violence to the law.
The*ln Lord*s is righteous within her; He*ln will do no injustice. Every*ln morning He brings His justice to light; He*ln does not fail. But*ln the unjust knows no shame.

“I*ln have cut off nations; Their*ln corner towers are in ruins. I*ln have made their streets desolate, With*ln no one passing by; Their*ln cities are laid waste, Without*ln a man, without an inhabitant.

I*ln said, ‘Surely you will revere Me, Accept*ln instruction.’ So*ln her dwelling will not be cut off According*iln to*i all that I have appointed concerning her. But*ln they were eager to corrupt all their deeds.

“Therefore*ln wait for Me,” declares the Lord,*s “For*ln the day when I rise up as a witness. Indeed,*ln My decision is to gather nations, To*ln assemble kingdoms, To*ln pour out on them My indignation, All*ln My burning anger; For*ln all the earth will be devoured By*ln the fire of My zeal.
For*ln then I will give to the peoples purified lips, That*ln all of them may call on the name of the Lord,*s To*ln serve Him shoulder to shoulder.
From*ln beyond the rivers of Ethiopia My*ln worshipers, My dispersed ones, Will*ln bring My offerings.

In*ln that day you will feel no shame Because*ln of all your deeds By*ln which you have rebelled against Me; For*ln then I will remove from your midst Your*ln proud, exulting ones, And*ln you will never again be haughty On*ln My holy mountain.
A Remnant of Israel
But*pn I will leave among you A*ln humble and lowly people, And*ln they will take refuge in the name of the Lord.*s
The*ln remnant of Israel will do no wrong And*ln tell no lies, Nor*ln will a deceitful tongue Be*ln found in their mouths; For*ln they will feed and lie down With*ln no one to make them tremble.”
Shout*ln for joy, O daughter of Zion! Shout*ln in*i triumph,*i O Israel! Rejoice*ln and exult with all your*i heart, O*ln daughter of Jerusalem!
The*ln Lord*s has taken away His*i judgments against you, He*ln has cleared away your enemies. The*ln King of Israel, the Lord,*s is in your midst; You*ln will fear disaster no more.
In*ln that day it will be said to Jerusalem: “Do*ln not be afraid, O Zion; Do*ln not let your hands fall limp.
The*ln Lord*s your God is in your midst, A*ln victorious warrior. He*ln will exult over you with joy, He*ln will be quiet in His love, He*ln will rejoice over you with shouts of joy.
I*ln will gather those who grieve about the appointed feasts— They*ln came from you, O*i Zion;*i The*iln reproach of*i exile*i is a burden on them.
Behold,*ln I am going to deal at that time With*ln all your oppressors, I*ln will save the lame And*ln gather the outcast, And*ln I will turn their shame into praise and renown In*ln all the earth.

At*ln that time I will bring you in, Even*ln at the time when I gather you together; Indeed,*ln I will give you renown and praise Among*ln all the peoples of the earth, When*ln I restore your fortunes before your eyes,” Says*ln the Lord.*s
